title: Hildr.Intro.Start1
body:
<<if $introFinished is false>>
Valiant warrior! 
I ask you your name...
...so that I may know who it is that has been so wrongfully cheated.

<<DialogueAction PuzzleManager AddLookMimir>>

[[Monrjiall.Intro.response]]

<<else>>
[[Hildr.Answer.Second]]
<<endif>>

title: Monrjiall.Intro.response
body:
<<if not visited ("Hildr.Intro.trust")>>
[[I will not tell you anything, you foul witch! I do not know you, therefore I cannot trust you!|Hildr.Intro.trust]]
<<endif>>
<<if not visited ("Hildr.Intro.confused")>>
[[Who has been cheated? And what does my name have to do with the poor fellow?|Hildr.Intro.confused]]
<<endif>>
[[The name’s Monrjiall, son of M’gsroell. Now, what’s this about somebody being cheated?|Hildr.Exp.explains]]

title: Hildr.Intro.trust
body:
I can assure you, I’m trustworthy.

[[Monrjiall.Intro.trust]]

title: Hildr.Intro.easy
body:
<<if not visited ("Hildr.Intro.confused")>>
Well, this might be easier than I thought...
<<else>>
On second thought, this might not be so hard...
<<endif>>
[[Monrjiall.Intro.response]]

title: Hildr.Intro.confused
body:
No, your name... 
I mean, that’s… 
What?

[[Monrjiall.Intro.victorious]]

title: Monrjiall.Intro.victorious
body:
Hah! You cannot match my wits!

[[Hildr.Intro.hard]]

title: Hildr.Intro.hard
body:
<<if not visited ("Hildr.Intro.trust")>>
*sigh* This is gonna be harder than I thought...
<<else>>
Well, this may not be so easy after all...
<<endif>>

[[Monrjiall.Intro.response]]
